intro: Sida pritzeliana, commonly known as the velvetleaf sida, is a flowering plant native to tropical and subtropical regions. It is characterized by its hairy, glandular leaves and small, pale yellow flowers that bloom in clusters. The plant belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. Sida pritzeliana typically grows in disturbed soils and is often found in agricultural areas. It is known for its ability to thrive in a variety of environmental conditions.
